name: closefriend
text: It was pickles on parade for Beef, the KKK, and Ray after all.

name: raccoon
text: what other services do they provide?

name: tekende
text: A similar service for women, except instead of apologizing for something, it's admitting that they were wrong about something.

name: sparhawk
text: THANK YOU.

name: apricotta
text:
No such site exists or will ever exist. If a woman is wrong, she still won't go any further than saying "I'm sorry* you don't see it my** way."

* you'll be sorry
** the only logical and true way

name: cryztal
text: Alternately: "I'm sorry but ."

name: rainwolfj
text: By logical and true way you mean emotionally unstable and logically unsound way, right?

name: choosebro
text: Man, we're just all so bitter .

name: patkun
text: Well, I guess Oscar Wilde never had this problem. Homosexuality must be so straightforward ...

name: dusty
text: I think this may be the root cause of gay hate "why don't they have to put up with this shit?"

name: greenkoolayd
text: i see what you did there... 'gay'.  'straightforeward'.  oh hee hee hee.

name: layzerblade
text: He was married to a lady, and evidence suggests he may have been bisexual, so it was really the worst of both worlds for him.

name: draykid
text: I love you for knowing that.

name: undyingsong
text: Jeez, no. Some of us gals admit that we are wrong about things on a regular basis. It's cool.

name: cagliostro
text: You're also happy to admit that Atlas was right, which is pretty sound.

name: fineoakstructure
text: ::shrug::

name: ganymedeio
text: Fuck you, Ayn Rand.

name: dissembly
text:
I want to write Atlas Shrugged hatefic where all Ayn Rand's conception of the Ideal Meritocratic Rulers of Earth fuck off into the desert and abandon civilisation to itself, and the rest of us left behind HAVE A BIG DAMN PARTY.

Fuck Ayn Rand.

name: dans
text: Ayn Rand: the woman who made being an asshole into a philosophy!

name: history
text: What's really funny these days is when Bill Maher aspouses these views without even knowing what he is talking about.

name: knuckleheadbabylon
text: El Gloppo has the illest taquitos.

name: bacter
text: This website has the statistics- people who send apologies are sorry for things in groups of three. Ray did not understand this, and commits a faux pax.

name: liquidcruelty
text: Yes, I feel the best part is that Ray was done after the first one and used his remaining space to dispense advice to Roast Beef

name: thommy_h
text: Best thing about this strip: Ray entered his name in the relevant field on the website with an exclamation mark.

name: tomsonlocal
text: I have to agree with this.

name: spinynorman
text: Probably had a crown on while he did it, too. This is LIFE, I mean.

name: brokeaccount
text: Personally I think it could have done with some of -=this=-

name: wehavemagnums
text: This strip reminded me of the recent custom romance novel one, which took this already great joke and improved on it ten-fold.

name: slalvation
text: Holy crap, there's an Achewood strip about custom romance novels? I have so much fun sending people samples of those with their own names in them!

name: gothfae
text: Best part of this strip is the progression of Beef's emotions, played totally with eyebrows over 3 panels.

name: glyphtheory
text: Seriously. Scowl, scowl, contemplative focus, then *poof*. Where did they go?

name: craigola
text: The stupid internet says it doesn't know anything about apologies4men.com! What the hell am I going to do if I ever need to apologize?

name: cathaoir
text: Chubby 'cause I also wish it was a real website.

name: trevor
text: Ray didn't know what to say to Roast Beef and had to use an apology e-service.

name: theunity
text: Ray isn't using his typical sign off signature.

name: yingkaixing
text: Because it was a form letter. It asked for his name, not his signature.

name: cdl146
text: I am sad that I did not come up with this idea first. Although I did once propose Bad News Bears(tm), in which small teddy bears would be sold with greeting cards which told people bad news that you did not want to tell in person.

name: lamelliform
text: Brilliant.  You'd send someone a "I'm divorcing you" bear or a "I totaled your car during my most recent drunken joyride" bear or whatever.

name: soticoto
text:
Or the classic "I impregnated your daughter, but she miscarried" bear.

On a similar note, I'd send many people a "Your baby is retarded" bear.

name: bourbonsamurai
text: chubbied for making me squirm.

name: aliiis
text:
Oh, oh god. THIS SORT OF HAPPENED.

So me and my friend were in a really bad charity shop near us. It was in fact so bad that it was closing down and so all the stuff was like 10p so we thought it would be awesome but it was sort of depressing or would have been if it wasn't so damn funny. She was just looking at an Eric Cantona annual from 1991 or something, and in this little cabinet thing in the corner, I clocked a small ceramic figurine of a teddy bear looking kinda sad and holding up a sign that simply said 'Sorry'. And there were two of them. I was trying to tell Luce and just laughing so much I had little hope of speaking and just waving my hands toward the cabinet to draw her attention to them and then when she saw them and her face I had to actually just leave and stand outside laughing because I felt terrible for the people who owned the shop. And because I was getting really worried that I wouldn't be able to stop laughing until I had urinated in my trousis or something. It was a wonderful, terrible thing.

name: rogergs
text: Due to the failure of this apology for men, Ray later developed and executed the Robert-Smith-by-proxy apology for men.

name: anatrafantastica
text: i like the "Hi" mat.  it's much more generic than a welcome mat

name: skiddyfisk
text: I love the entire first panel. Or second, if you count the KNOCK KNOCK.

name: paperboy_2000
text: Oh, man, I never realized that the Welcome Mat said "Hi".  I was reading it as "dti".  I assumed that dti (Digital Technologies International?) was some short-lived Bay Area dot-com company and Beef had bought their doormat in the bankruptcy sale.

name: bixschmix
text: I would purchase one. I would pay a fair price for it.

name: deancain29
text: A comment left by deancain29 was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by Connellingus, pitseleh, cathaoir)

name: aaron_haynes
text: I've said it before, I'll say it again, Ray sucks at apologies more than any man alive.

name: henrythecad
text: Anybody find it overly convenient how THAT PLACE BY THE INTERSECTION is followed smoothly by ''for a little while''?

name: stuart
text: The form assumes you will only be sorry for so long.

name: deusoma
text: If it weren't for the fact that I've never seen Onstad make any typos, I'd assume he hit caps lock again too soon.

name: quinlaenar
text:
http://achewood.com/index.php?date=05142004
Alt Text: GOOT / The Typo that became Dialogue

name: nighttoad
text: i like how molly tries to stop beef from picking up the letter, and when he bends down to do so she runs back inside. i don't really get it, but i like it.

name: drummk
text: I was under the impression that she thought it might be a letter bomb / anthrax / etc, hence the "no return address".

name: nighttoad
text: oh wow, i didn't even think of that. i sure feel silly.

name: falseprophet
text: Am I the only one who thought the letter was supposed to be a veiled threat when I first read it? Like, "Wow, is the anti-racialist lobby so insecure that it feels it has to kill you when you talk to the KKK?"

name: fattypneumonia
text: Molly in the panel where she says "Beef! Wait!" = 5.  Perfect acting: her facial expression, her hand wringing.  You can almost hear the concern in her voice.

name: fuschia
text: I love Ray's stock apology letter.

name: ceokasen
text: I love that Ray seems to have this pathological inability to determine what will , gramatically result with which words stuck into which forms. "and that OR THAT PLACE BY THE INTERSECTION THAT I CALL EL GLOPPO", and "But for now, the my pool house was the limits of their world."

name: waldo913
text: apologiesformen.com works a lot better with CapsLock off.  I know this from experience.

name: dwodles
text: "apologies4men.com" made this a five.

text:
Um hey guys...

http://www.bureauofcommunication.com/compose/apology

AWESOME.

text: oh nice

Apologies4men.com
When saying sorry just isn't enough.

text: Beef! Wait! Don't pick up the letter for you!

name: zem
text: this confused me as well

name: dans
text: I think she's just afraid since a lot of people hate Beef right now. A letter with no return address seems kind of dangerous.

name: direhaggis
text:
The short version of Ray's online telegram being:

Whoops. Full Stop.

name: keir
text:
Dogg It Must Feel Sick As Hell to Receive a Card from a Dude.
(Ain't This Just Sick As Hell )

name: apricotta
text: I love how Ray manages to use the site, but fails to send his apology on the Internet and prints it instead.

name: killingthejay
text: I know that taqueria (El Grullense).  We call it El Greasy.

name: talbain
text: why has no one bought that web address yet?

name: mustakrakesh
text: apologies4men.com! For that un-gay apology!

name: americanadiano
text: I'm not sure if anyone has noticed, but it appears that Roast Beef doesn't bite his nails as much as he used to in the past.

name: greenkoolayd
text: fingernails(a cats claws, as well) constantly grow back.  every so often, youre going to see them in a not-so-chewed, or even unchewed state.

text: read the letter out loud, but shout whenever you get to bold

Molly was afraid it was anthrax.

Also, Ray is the subtlest cat on the block.
